program_info.name: The Ultimate Push Pull Legs System

phase1.description: Phase 1 - Base Hypertrophy (Moderate Volume, Moderate Intensity)

push1.name: Bench Press
push1.notes: Set up a comfortable arch, quick pause on the chest and explode up on each rep

push1.name: High-Incline Smith Machine Press
push1.notes: Set the bench at a 45-60° incline, touch the bar to your upper chest with control

push1.name: Egyptian Cable Lateral Raise
push1.notes: Lean away from the cable. Focus on squeezing your delts.

push1.name: Overhead Cable Triceps Extension
push1.notes: Do both arms at once, resist the negative

push1.name: Cable Triceps Kickback
push1.notes: Lean slightly forward, lock your elbow behind your torso (shoulder hyperextension)

pull1.name: Neutral-Grip Lat Pulldown
pull1.notes: Pull your elbows down against your sides

pull1.name: Pendlay Row
pull1.notes: Initiate the movement by squeezing your shoulder blades together, pull to your lower chest, avoid using momentum

pull1.name: Reverse Pec Deck
pull1.notes: Swing the weight "out", not "back"

pull1.name: EZ-Bar Curl
pull1.notes: Arc the bar "out" not "up", focus on squeezing your biceps

pull1.name: Hammer Cheat Curl
pull1.notes: You can use slight momentum on the concentric, but control the eccentric with your elbows stationary

legs1.name: Squat or Machine Squat
legs1.notes: Sit back and down, keep your upper back tight to the bar

legs1.name: Barbell RDL
legs1.notes: Maintain a neutral lower back, set your hips back, don't allow your spine to round

legs1.name: Leg Extension
legs1.notes: Focus on squeezing your quads to make the weight move.

legs1.name: Seated Calf Raise
legs1.notes: Press all the way up to your toes, stretch your calves at the bottom, don't bounce

legs1.name: Cable Crunch
legs1.notes: Round your back as you crunch

push2.name: Seated DB Shoulder Press
push2.notes: Bring the dumbbells all the way down, keep your torso upright

push2.name: Weighted Dip
push2.notes: Tuck your elbows at 45°, lean your torso forward 15°, shoulder width or slightly wider grip

push2.name: Machine Lateral Raise
push2.notes: Focus on squeezing your lateral delt to move the weight

push2.name: Triceps Pressdown
push2.notes: Focus on squeezing your triceps to move the weight

pull2.name: Wide-Grip Pull-Up
pull2.notes: Use ~1.5x shoulder width grip. Add weight or use assistance as needed to hit RPE. Keep form as consistent as possible.

pull2.name: Close-Grip Seated Cable Row
pull2.notes: Focus on squeezing your shoulder blades together, drive your elbows down and back.

pull2.name: Machine Shrug
pull2.notes: Shrug up and in. Pull your shoulders up to your ears.

pull2.name: Alternating DB Curl
pull2.notes: Alternate arms with each curl: do 1 rep with your right arm, one rep with your left arm. Repeat until you reach 4-6 reps with each arm.

pull2.name: 1-Arm DB Preacher Curl
pull2.notes: Here, do all 6-8 reps with one arm at a time (do not alternate)

legs2.name: Deadlift
legs2.notes: Brace your lats, chest tall, pull the slack out of the bar before lifting

legs2.name: Stiff-Leg Deadlift
legs2.notes: Think about doing a high-hip conventional deadlift with a slight bend in the knees

legs2.name: Leg Press
legs2.notes: Medium width feet placement on the platform, don't allow your lower back to round

legs2.name: Glute Ham Raise
legs2.notes: Keep your hips straight, do Nordic ham curls if no GHR machine

legs2.name: Slow-Eccentric Leg Extension
legs2.notes: Control the weight with a 3-4 second negative

legs2.name: Seated Calf Raise
legs2.notes: Press all the way up to your toes, stretch your calves at the bottom, don't bounce

legs2.name: Roman Chair Leg Raise
legs2.notes: Don't swing your legs at the bottom, minimize momentum, tuck your knees towards your chest if lifting your legs straight out is too challenging

legs2.name: Hack Squat
legs2.notes: Allow your knees to come forward (past your toes), focus the tension on your quads

legs2.name: Dumbbell Walking Lunge
legs2.notes: Do 4-6 reps with each leg (10-12 total strides). Straps may be helpful if your grip becomes limiting.

legs2.name: Seated Leg Curl
legs2.notes: Focus on squeezing your hamstrings to move the weight

legs2.name: Standing Calf Raise
legs2.notes: Press all the way up to your toes, stretch your calves at the bottom, don't bounce

legs2.name: Decline Plate-Weighted Crunch
legs2.notes: Hold a plate or DB to your chest and crunch hard!

push2.name: Seated DB Shoulder Press
push2.notes: Bring the dumbbells all the way down, keep your torso upright

push2.name: Weighted Dip

push2.name: Machine Lateral Raise

push2.name: Triceps Pressdown

pull2.name: Wide-Grip Pull-Up

pull2.name: Close-Grip Seated Cable Row
pull2.notes: Focus on squeezing your shoulder blades together, drive your elbows down and back.

pull2.name: Machine Shrug
pull2.notes: Shrug up and in. Pull your shoulders up to your ears.

pull2.name: Alternating DB Curl
pull2.notes: Alternate arms with each curl: do 1 rep with your right arm, one rep with your left arm. Repeat until you reach 4-6 reps with each arm.

pull2.name: 1-Arm DB Preacher Curl
pull2.notes: Here, do all 6-8 reps with one arm at a time (do not alternate)

legs2.name: Deadlift
legs2.notes: Can pull sumo or conventional, go with whatever variation you are stronger with

legs2.name: Dumbbell Walking Lunge
legs2.notes: Do 4-6 reps with each leg (10-12 total strides). Straps may be helpful if your grip becomes limiting.

legs2.name: Seated Leg Curl
legs2.notes: Focus on squeezing your hamstrings to move the weight

legs2.name: Standing Calf Raise
legs2.notes: Press all the way up to your toes, stretch your calves at the bottom, don't bounce

legs2.name: Decline Plate-Weighted Crunch
legs2.notes: Hold a plate or DB to your chest and crunch hard!

push2.notes: Bring the dumbbells all the way down, keep your torso upright

push2.notes: Tuck your elbows at 45°, lean your torso forward 15°, shoulder width or slightly wider grip

push2.name: Machine Lateral Raise
push2.notes: Focus on squeezing your lateral delt to move the weight

push2.name: Triceps Pressdown
push2.notes: Focus on squeezing your triceps to move the weight

pull2.name: Wide-Grip Pull-Up
pull2.notes: Use ~1.5x shoulder width grip. Add weight or use assistance as needed to hit RPE. Keep form as consistent as possible.

pull2.name: Close-Grip Seated Cable Row
pull2.notes: Focus on squeezing your shoulder blades together, drive your elbows down and back.

pull2.notes: Shrug up and in. Pull your shoulders up to your ears.

pull2.name: Alternating DB Curl
pull2.notes: Alternate arms with each curl: do 1 rep with your right arm, one rep with your left arm. Repeat until you reach 4-6 reps with each arm.

pull2.name: 1-Arm DB Preacher Curl
pull2.notes: Here, do all 6-8 reps with one arm at a time (do not alternate)

legs2.name: Deadlift
legs2.notes: Brace your lats, chest tall, pull the slack out of the bar before lifting

legs2.name: Stiff-Leg Deadlift

legs2.name: Leg Press
legs2.notes: Medium width feet placement on the platform, don't allow your lower back to round

legs2.name: Glute Ham Raise

legs2.name: Slow-Eccentric Leg Extension
legs2.notes: Control the weight with a 3-4 second negative

legs2.name: Seated Calf Raise

legs2.name: Roman Chair Leg Raise

push1.name: Bench Press
push1.notes: Set up a comfortable arch, quick pause on the chest and explode up on each rep

push1.name: Larsen Press
push1.notes: Shoulder blades still retracted and depressed. Slight arch in upper back. Zero leg drive.

push1.name: Standing Dumbbell Arnold Press
push1.notes: Start with your elbows in front of you and palms facing in. Rotate the dumbbells so that your palms face forward as you press.

push1.name: A1. Press-Around
push1.notes: Brace with your non-working arm, squeeze your pecs by pressing the cable across your body

push1.name: A2. Pec Static Stretch 30s
push1.notes: Hold a pec stretch for 30 seconds. The stretch should be held at about a 7/10 intensity.

push1.name: Cross-Body Cable Y-Raise (Side Delt)
push1.notes: Think about swinging the cable out and up as if "drawing a sword" from your side

push1.name: Squeeze-Only Triceps Pressdown + Stretch-Only Overhead Triceps Extension
push1.notes: Do the second half of the ROM for pressdowns ("the squeeze") and the first half of the ROM for overhead extensions ("the stretch")

push1.name: N1-Style Cross-Body Triceps Extension
push1.notes: Extend your triceps with your arm more out to the side than a regular pressdown. Feel the stretch as the cable moves across your torso

pull1.name: Lat Pulldown (Feeder Sets)
pull1.notes: Do 4 feeder sets of 10 reps by gradually building the weight up from set to set. Set 1 is pretty light (RPE 4-5). Set 2 is a little heavier (RPE 6-7). Set 3 is a little heavier again (RPE 7-8). Set 4 is your hard set: try to hit failure at 10 reps on this last set.

pull1.name: Lat Pulldown (Failure Set)
pull1.notes: After hitting failure at ~10 reps, do a dropset. Strip the weight back ~30-50% and do another 5 reps with nice and controlled technique

pull1.name: Omni-Grip Machine Chest-Supported Row
pull1.notes: Use 3 different grips for the 3 working sets (ideally going from wider to closer)

pull1.name: A1. Bottom-Half DB Lat Pullover
pull1.notes: Do DB lat pullovers, but cut out the top half of the ROM (stay entirely in the stretched aspect of the lift)

pull1.name: A2. Lat Static Stretch 30s
pull1.notes: Hold a lat stretch for 30 seconds. The stretch should be held at about a 7/10 intensity.

pull1.name: Omni-Direction Face Pull
pull1.notes:
1st set: low-to-high
2nd set: mid-range
3rd set: high-to-low

pull1.name: EZ-Bar Curl
pull1.notes: Focus on contracting your biceps, minimize torso momentum

pull1.name: Bottom-Half Preacher Curl
pull1.notes: Do preacher curls, but cut out the top half of the ROM (stay entirely in the stretched aspect of the lift)

legs1.name: Squat
legs1.notes: Sit back and down, keep your upper back tight to the bar

legs1.name: Pause Squat (Back off)
legs1.notes: Drop the weight by ~25% from your top set. 2 second pause. Sit back and down, keep your upper back tight to the bar

legs1.name: Barbell RDL
legs1.notes: Maintain a neutral lower back, set your hips back, don't allow your spine to round

legs1.name: Walking Lunge
legs1.notes: Take medium strides, minimize the amount you push off your rear leg

legs1.name: Seated Leg Curl
legs1.notes: Focus on squeezing your hamstrings to move the weight

legs1.name: Leg Press Toe Press
legs1.notes: Press all the way up to your toes, stretch your calves at the bottom, don't bounce

legs1.name: Decline Plate-Weighted Crunch
legs1.notes: Hold a plate or DB to your chest and crunch hard!

push2.name: Close-Grip Barbell Incline Press
push2.notes: Use ~45° incline and a grip width just outside shoulder width

push2.name: Machine Shoulder Press
push2.notes: Don't stop in between reps, keep smooth and controlled tension on the delts

push2.name: Floor Skull Crusher (Heavy)
push2.notes: Arc the bar behind your head, allow the bar to come to a dead stop on the floor between reps

push2.name: Bent-Over Cable Pec Flye
push2.notes: Squeeze your pecs together at the top and feel a big stretch at the bottom

push2.name: Eccentric-Accentuated Cable Lateral Raise, Constant-Tension Cable Lateral Raise
push2.notes: First 5 reps: 5-second lowering phase, last 15 reps constant tension (no pausing at the bottom or top)

push2.name: Plate Front Raise
push2.notes: Turn one side up like a steering wheel as you lift the plate

push2.name: Diamond Push Up
push2.notes: Place your hands close together on the ground so that they form a diamond shape and do as many pushups as possible with a smooth tempo

pull2.name: 1-Arm Half-Kneeling Lat Pulldown
pull2.notes: Keep chest tall, keep elbow tucked in close to your torso, focus on squeezing your lat to move the weight

pull2.name: Pull-Up (1 AMRAP set)
pull2.notes: 1.5x shoulder width grip, pull your chest to the bar

pull2.name: Kroc Row
pull2.notes: Kroc rows are basically just a dumbbell row with mild cheating and a slightly more upright posture. Don't be afraid to go heavy and use straps if your grip is limiting

pull2.name: Cable Shrug-In
pull2.notes: Set up two cable handles low and shrug up and in. Squeeze your upper traps to move the weight.

pull2.name: Reverse Pec Deck
pull2.notes: Swing the weight "out", not "back"

pull2.name: N1-Style Cross-Body Cable Bicep Curl
pull2.notes: Curl across your body with your arm out to the side at ~60°

legs2.name: Deadlift
legs2.notes: Brace your lats, chest tall, pull the slack out of the bar before lifting

legs2.name: Stiff-Leg Deadlift
legs2.notes: Think about doing a high-hip conventional deadlift with a slight bend in the knees

legs2.name: Leg Press
legs2.notes: Medium width feet placement on the platform, don't allow your lower back to round

legs2.name: Glute Ham Raise
legs2.notes: Keep your hips straight, do Nordic ham curls if no GHR machine

legs2.name: Slow-Eccentric Leg Extension
legs2.notes: Control the weight with a 3-4 second negative

legs2.name: Seated Calf Raise
legs2.notes: Press all the way up to your toes, stretch your calves at the bottom, don't bounce

legs2.name: Roman Chair Leg Raise
legs2.notes: Don't swing your legs at the bottom, minimize momentum, tuck your knees towards your chest if lifting your legs straight out is too challenging

pull1.name: Bottom-Half Preacher Curl

pull2.name: Pull-Up (1 AMRAP set)
pull2.notes: 1.5x shoulder width grip, pull your chest to the bar

pull2.name: Kroc Row

pull2.name: Reverse Pec Deck
pull2.notes: Swing the weight "out", not "back"

pull2.name: N1-Style Cross-Body Cable Bicep Curl
pull2.notes: Curl across your body with your arm out to the side at ~60°

phase2.description: Phase 2 - Maximum Effort (Low volume, high intensity)

push1.name: Bench Press
push1.notes: Set up a comfortable arch, quick pause on the chest and explode up on each rep

push1.name: High-Incline Smith Machine Press
push1.notes: Set the bench at a 45-60° incline, touch the bar to your upper chest with control

push1.name: Egyptian Cable Lateral Raise
push1.notes: Lean away from the cable. Focus on squeezing your delts.

push1.name: Overhead Cable Triceps Extension
push1.notes: Do both arms at once, resist the negative

push1.name: Cable Triceps Kickback
push1.notes: Lean slightly forward, lock your elbow behind your torso (shoulder hyperextension)

pull1.name: Neutral-Grip Lat Pulldown
pull1.notes: Pull your elbows down against your sides

pull1.name: Pendlay Row
pull1.notes: Initiate the movement by squeezing your shoulder blades together, pull to your lower chest, avoid using momentum

pull1.name: Reverse Pec Deck
pull1.notes: Swing the weight "out", not "back"

pull1.name: EZ-Bar Curl
pull1.notes: Arc the bar "out" not "up", focus on squeezing your biceps

pull1.name: Hammer Cheat Curl
pull1.notes: You can use slight momentum on the concentric, but control the eccentric with your elbows stationary

legs1.name: Squat or Machine Squat
legs1.notes: Sit back and down, keep your upper back tight to the bar

legs1.name: Barbell RDL
legs1.notes: Maintain a neutral lower back, set your hips back, don't allow your spine to round

legs1.name: Leg Extension
legs1.notes: Focus on squeezing your quads to make the weight move.

legs1.name: Seated Calf Raise
legs1.notes: Press all the way up to your toes, stretch your calves at the bottom, don't bounce

legs1.name: Cable Crunch
legs1.notes: Round your back as you crunch

push2.name: Seated DB Shoulder Press
push2.notes: Bring the dumbbells all the way down, keep your torso upright

push2.name: Weighted Dip
push2.notes: Tuck your elbows at 45°, lean your torso forward 15°, shoulder width or slightly wider grip

push2.name: Machine Lateral Raise
push2.notes: Focus on squeezing your lateral delt to move the weight

push2.name: Triceps Pressdown
push2.notes: Focus on squeezing your triceps to move the weight

pull2.name: Wide-Grip Pull-Up
pull2.notes: Use ~1.5x shoulder width grip. Add weight or use assistance as needed to hit RPE. Keep form as consistent as possible.

pull2.name: Close-Grip Seated Cable Row
pull2.notes: Focus on squeezing your shoulder blades together, drive your elbows down and back.

pull2.name: Machine Shrug
pull2.notes: Shrug up and in. Pull your shoulders up to your ears.

pull2.name: Alternating DB Curl
pull2.notes: Alternate arms with each curl: do 1 rep with your right arm, one rep with your left arm. Repeat until you reach 4-6 reps with each arm.

pull2.name: 1-Arm DB Preacher Curl
pull2.notes: Here, do all 6-8 reps with one arm at a time (do not alternate)

legs2.name: Hack Squat
legs2.notes: Allow your knees to come forward (past your toes), focus the tension on your quads

legs2.name: Dumbbell Walking Lunge
legs2.notes: Do 4-6 reps with each leg (10-12 total strides). Straps may be helpful if your grip becomes limiting.

legs2.name: Seated Leg Curl
legs2.notes: Focus on squeezing your hamstrings to move the weight

legs2.name: Standing Calf Raise
legs2.notes: Press all the way up to your toes, stretch your calves at the bottom, don't bounce

legs2.name: Decline Plate-Weighted Crunch
legs2.notes: Hold a plate or DB to your chest and crunch hard!

push1.name: Bench Press
push1.notes: Set up a comfortable arch, quick pause on the chest and explode up on each rep

push1.name: High-Incline Smith Machine Press
push1.notes: Set the bench at a 45-60° incline, touch the bar to your upper chest with control

push1.name: Egyptian Cable Lateral Raise
push1.notes: Lean away from the cable. Focus on squeezing your delts.

push1.name: Overhead Cable Triceps Extension
push1.notes: Do both arms at once, resist the negative

push1.name: Cable Triceps Kickback
push1.notes: Lean slightly forward, lock your elbow behind your torso (shoulder hyperextension)

pull1.name: Neutral-Grip Lat Pulldown
pull1.notes: Pull your elbows down against your sides

pull1.notes: Initiate the movement by squeezing your shoulder blades together, pull to your lower chest, avoid using momentum

pull1.notes: Swing the weight "out", not "back"

pull1.name: EZ-Bar Curl
pull1.notes: Arc the bar "out" not "up", focus on squeezing your biceps

pull1.name: Hammer Cheat Curl
pull1.notes: You can use slight momentum on the concentric, but control the eccentric with your elbows stationary

legs1.name: Seated Calf Raise
legs1.notes: Press all the way up to your toes, stretch your calves at the bottom, don't bounce

legs1.name: Cable Crunch
legs1.notes: Round your back as you crunch

push2.name: Triceps Pressdown
push2.notes: Focus on squeezing your triceps to move the weight

pull2.name: 1-Arm DB Preacher Curl
pull2.notes: Here, do all 6-8 reps with one arm at a time (do not alternate)

legs2.notes: Can pull sumo or conventional, go with whatever variation you are stronger with

legs2.name: Dumbbell Walking Lunge

legs2.name: Standing Calf Raise
legs2.notes: Press all the way up to your toes, stretch your calves at the bottom, don't bounce

legs2.name: Decline Plate-Weighted Crunch
legs2.notes: Hold a plate or DB to your chest and crunch hard!

push1.name: High-Incline Smith Machine Press
push1.notes: Set the bench at a 45-60 degree incline, touch the bar to your upper chest with control

push1.name: Egyptian Cable Lateral Raise
push1.notes: Lean away from the cable. Focus on squeezing your delts.

push1.name: Overhead Cable Triceps Extension
push1.notes: Do both arms at once, resist the negative

push1.name: Cable Triceps Kickback
push1.notes: Lean slightly forward, lock your elbow behind your torso (shoulder hyperextension)

pull1.name: Neutral-Grip Lat Pulldown
pull1.notes: Pull your elbows down against your sides

pull1.name: Pendlay Row
pull1.notes: Initiate the movement by squeezing your shoulder blades together, pull to your lower chest, avoid using momentum

pull1.name: Reverse Pec Deck
pull1.notes: Swing the weight "out", not "back"

pull1.name: EZ-Bar Curl
pull1.notes: Arc the bar "out" not "up", focus on squeezing your biceps

pull1.name: Hammer Cheat Curl
pull1.notes: You can use slight momentum on the concentric, but control the eccentric with your elbows stationary

legs1.name: Squat or Machine Squat
legs1.notes: Sit back and down, keep your upper back tight to the bar

legs1.name: Barbell RDL
legs1.notes: Maintain a neutral lower back, set your hips back, don't allow your spine to round

legs1.name: Leg Extension
legs1.notes: Focus on squeezing your quads to make the weight move.

legs1.name: Seated Calf Raise
legs1.notes: Press all the way up to your toes, stretch your calves at the bottom, don't bounce

legs1.name: Cable Crunch
legs1.notes: Round your back as you crunch

push2.name: Seated DB Shoulder Press
push2.notes: Bring the dumbbells all the way down, keep your torso upright

push2.name: Weighted Dip
push2.notes: Tuck your elbows at 45°, lean your torso forward 15°, shoulder width or slightly wider grip

push2.name: Machine Lateral Raise
push2.notes: Focus on squeezing your lateral delt to move the weight

push2.name: Triceps Pressdown
push2.notes: Focus on squeezing your triceps to move the weight

pull2.name: Wide-Grip Pull-Up
pull2.notes: Use ~1.5x shoulder width grip. Add weight or use assistance as needed to hit RPE. Keep form as consistent as possible.

pull2.name: Close-Grip Seated Cable Row
pull2.notes: Focus on squeezing your shoulder blades together, drive your elbows down and back.

pull2.name: Machine Shrug
pull2.notes: Shrug up and in. Pull your shoulders up to your ears.

pull2.name: Alternating DB Curl
pull2.notes: Alternate arms with each curl: do 1 rep with your right arm, one rep with your left arm. Repeat until you reach 4-6 reps with each arm.

pull2.name: 1-Arm DB Preacher Curl
pull2.notes: Here, do all 6-8 reps with one arm at a time (do not alternate)

push1.name: Low Incline DB Press
push1.notes: 15° bench angle, tuck your elbows on the negative, flare as you press

push1.name: Machine Shoulder Press
push1.notes: Don't stop in between reps, keep smooth and controlled tension on the delts

push1.name: Cable Crossover Ladder
push1.notes: Do one set with low cable position, one set with medium-height cable position, and one height with a high cable position

push1.name: A1: Lean-In Constant Tension DB Lateral Raise
push1.notes: Lean into a bench and do lateral raises. Keep tension - don't rest your arm against your side at the bottom.

push1.name: A2: Side Delt Static Stretch (30s)
push1.notes: Hold a side delt stretch for 30 seconds. The stretch should be held at about a 7/10 intensity.

push1.name: Overhead Triceps Extension
push1.notes: Do both arms at once, resist the negative

push1.name: Med-Ball Close Grip Push Up
push1.notes: Place your hands on a medicine ball and do smooth, controlled pushups

pull1.name: 1-Arm Half Kneeling Lat Pulldown
pull1.notes: Keep chest tall, keep elbow tucked in close to your torso, focus on squeezing your lat to move the weight

pull1.name: Omni-Grip Lat Pulldown
pull1.notes: One set wide grip (overhand), 1 set middle grip (overhand), 1 set close grip (underhand)

pull1.name: Machine Low Row
pull1.notes: Focus on squeezing your shoulder blades together on each rep

pull1.name: Cable Shrug-In
pull1.notes: Set up two cable handles low and shrug up and in. Squeeze your upper traps to move the weight.

pull1.name: Reverse Pec Deck
pull1.notes: Swing the weight "out", not "back"

pull1.name: EZ-Bar Curl (Heavy)
pull1.notes: Arc the bar "out" not "up", focus on squeezing your biceps

pull1.name: A1: EZ-Bar Modified Bicep 21's
pull1.notes: 7 reps seated, 7 reps standing full ROM, 7 reps bottom-half curls

pull1.name: A2: Bicep Static Stretch (30s)
pull1.notes: Hold a bicep stretch for 30 seconds. The stretch should be held at about a 7/10 intensity.

legs1.name: Front Squat
legs1.notes: These will be challenging, let's push! Don't go so heavy that you miss reps. Be humble with your weight and focus on keeping your torso upright

legs1.name: Dumbbell RDL
legs1.notes: Emphasize the stretch in your hamstrings, prevent your lower back from rounding

legs1.name: Walking Lunge
legs1.notes: Take medium strides, minimize the amount you push off your rear leg

legs1.name: Slow Seated Leg Curl (3 up, 3 down)
legs1.notes: Lift with a slow tempo. The positive should take 3 seconds and the negative should take 3 seconds.

legs1.name: Leg Press Toe Press
legs1.notes: Press all the way up to your toes, stretch your calves at the bottom, don't bounce

legs1.name: LLPT Plank
legs1.notes: Contract your glutes and position your elbows under your eyes to make the plank more difficult

push2.name: Bench Press (Top Set)
push2.notes: Set up a comfortable arch, quick pause on the chest and explode up on each rep

push2.name: Bench Press (Back Off AMRAP)
push2.notes: Use ~60% of the weight you used on your top set and do it for as many reps as possible. You should be in the range of 10-20+ reps on this set! Use a spotter and safety bars!

push2.name: Standing Dumbbell Arnold Press
push2.notes: Start with your elbows in front of you and palms facing in. Rotate the dumbbells so that your palms face forward as you press.

push2.name: Weighted Dip
push2.notes: Tuck your elbows at 45°, lean your torso forward 15°, shoulder width or slightly wider grip

push2.name: Machine Lateral Raise (+ Myoreps)
push2.notes: On the last set only, perform myoreps: After reaching failure at 12-15 reps, pause for ~5 seconds and do another 4 reps. Then pause for ~5 seconds again and do another 4 reps. Repeat until you can't complete 4 reps.

push2.name: Triceps Pressdown
push2.notes: Focus on squeezing your triceps to move the weight

push2.name: 1-Arm Bottom-Half Overhead Cable Tricep Extensions
push2.notes: Do overhead cable tricep extensions, but cut out the top half of the ROM (stay entirely in the stretched aspect of the lift)

pull2.name: Pull-Up
pull2.notes: 6 cluster sets: 3 reps, rest 15s, repeat 6x. Keep form smooth and controlled.

pull2.name: Wide-Grip Cable Row
pull2.notes: 10 cluster sets: 3 reps, rest 15s, repeat 10x. Keep form tight.

pull2.name: SLOW Barbell Row (3 up, 3 down)
pull2.notes: Use a 3 second positive and a 3 second negative. "Feel" your back working, be humble with the weight you use

pull2.name: Bayesian Cable Curl
pull2.notes: Keep your elbow behind your torso throughout the range of motion, focus on squeezing your bicep. Sets are per arm

pull2.name: Bottom-Half Preacher Curl
pull2.notes: Do preacher curls, but cut out the top half of the ROM (stay entirely in the stretched aspect of the lift)

pull2.name: Rope Facepull
pull2.notes: Pull your elbows up and out, squeeze your shoulder blades together

legs2.name: Deadlift
legs2.notes: Brace your lats, chest tall, pull the slack out of the bar before lifting

legs2.name: Leg Press
legs2.notes: Medium width feet placement on the platform, don't allow your lower back to round

legs2.name: Leg Extension
legs2.notes: Focus on squeezing your quads to make the weight move

legs2.name: Lying Leg Curl
legs2.notes: Focus on squeezing your hamstrings to make the weight move

legs2.name: Seated Calf Raise
legs2.notes: Press all the way up to your toes, stretch your calves at the bottom, don't bounce

legs2.name: Corpse Crunch
legs2.notes: Clear your upper back off the floor when you crunch, hold for 1-2 seconds and then go back down. Don't yank with your neck.

push1.name: Low Incline DB Press
push1.notes: 15° bench angle, tuck your elbows on the negative, flare as you press

push1.name: Machine Shoulder Press
push1.notes: Don't stop in between reps, keep smooth and controlled tension on the delts

push1.name: Cable Crossover Ladder
push1.notes: Do one set with low cable position, one set with medium-height cable position, and one height with a high cable position

push1.name: A1: Lean-In Constant Tension DB Lateral Raise
push1.notes: Lean into a bench and do lateral raises. Keep tension - don't rest your arm against your side at the bottom.

push1.name: A2: Side Delt Static Stretch (30s)
push1.notes: Hold a side delt stretch for 30 seconds. The stretch should be held at about a 7/10 intensity.

push1.name: Overhead Triceps Extension
push1.notes: Do both arms at once, resist the negative

push1.name: Med-Ball Close Grip Push Up
push1.notes: Place your hands on a medicine ball and do smooth, controlled pushups

pull1.name: 1-Arm Half Kneeling Lat Pulldown
pull1.notes: Keep chest tall, keep elbow tucked in close to your torso, focus on squeezing your lat to move the weight

pull1.name: Omni-Grip Lat Pulldown
pull1.notes: One set wide grip (overhand), 1 set middle grip (overhand), 1 set close grip (underhand)

pull1.name: Machine Low Row
pull1.notes: Focus on squeezing your shoulder blades together on each rep

pull1.name: Cable Shrug-In
pull1.notes: Set up two cable handles low and shrug up and in. Squeeze your upper traps to move the weight.

pull1.name: Reverse Pec Deck
pull1.notes: Swing the weight "out", not "back"

pull1.name: EZ-Bar Curl (Heavy)
pull1.notes: Arc the bar "out" not "up", focus on squeezing your biceps

pull1.name: A1: EZ-Bar Modified Bicep 21's
pull1.notes: 7 reps seated, 7 reps standing full ROM, 7 reps bottom-half curls

pull1.name: A2: Bicep Static Stretch (30s)
pull1.notes: Hold a bicep stretch for 30 seconds. The stretch should be held at about a 7/10 intensity.

push2.notes: Start with your elbows in front of you and palms facing in. Rotate the dumbbells so that your palms face forward as you press.

push2.name: Weighted Dip
push2.notes: Tuck your elbows at 45°, lean your torso forward 15°, shoulder width or slightly wider grip

push2.name: Machine Lateral Raise (+ Myoreps)
push2.notes: On the last set only, perform myoreps: After reaching failure at 12-15 reps, pause for ~5 seconds and do another 4 reps. Then pause for ~5 seconds again and do another 4 reps. Repeat until you can't complete 4 reps.

push2.name: Triceps Pressdown
push2.notes: Focus on squeezing your triceps to move the weight

push2.name: 1-Arm Bottom-Half Overhead Cable Tricep Extensions
push2.notes: Do overhead cable tricep extensions, but cut out the top half of the ROM (stay entirely in the stretched aspect of the lift)

pull2.name: Pull-Up
pull2.notes: 4 cluster sets: 3 reps, rest 15s, repeat 4x. Keep form smooth and controlled.

pull2.name: Wide-Grip Cable Row
pull2.notes: 6 cluster sets: 3 reps, rest 15s, repeat 6x. Keep form tight.

pull2.name: SLOW Barbell Row (3 up, 3 down)
pull2.notes: Use a 3 second positive and a 3 second negative. "Feel" your back working, be humble with the weight you use

pull2.name: Bayesian Cable Curl
pull2.notes: Keep your elbow behind your torso throughout the range of motion, focus on squeezing your bicep. Sets are per arm

pull2.name: Bottom-Half Preacher Curl
pull2.notes: Do preacher curls, but cut out the top half of the ROM (stay entirely in the stretched aspect of the lift)

pull2.name: Rope Facepull
pull2.notes: Pull your elbows up and out, squeeze your shoulder blades together
